translated: When one attains right determination and sees the truth of suffering in an instant, sees the truth of accumulation in an instant, sees the truth of cessation in an instant, sees the truth of the path in an instant, when one attains the fruit of stream-entry and produces the knowledge of dharmas and makes it present, up to when one who is liberated according to circumstances changes faculties and becomes unshakable, and produces the knowledge of dharmas and makes it present.
If one possesses present dharma knowledge, does one also possess future [dharma knowledge]?
Answer:
So it is.
Why is it so?
If one possesses present dharma knowledge, one definitely possesses future [dharma knowledge].
If one possesses past dharma knowledge, does one also possess future and present [dharma knowledge]?
Answer:
One possesses future [dharma knowledge], and present [dharma knowledge] if it is presently manifest.
At what time does one possess dharma knowledge of the three times?
Answer:

When one attains right determination, at the time of seeing the truth of accumulation in one thought moment, at the time of seeing the truth of cessation in one thought moment, at the time of seeing the truth of the path in one thought moment, when one attains the fruit of stream-entry, having already extinguished dharma knowledge manifest in the present, up to the time of liberation through understanding turning the faculties to become unshakable, having already extinguished dharma knowledge manifest in the present.
If one possesses future and present dharma knowledge, does one also possess past [dharma knowledge]?
Answer:
If it has already ceased but has not been lost, then one possesses it, as explained before.
If it is not extinguished or if it is extinguished but lost, then it is not accomplished.
At what time does one accomplish future and present dharma cognition, but not past [dharma cognition]?
Answer:

When one attains right determination and sees the truth of suffering for one moment, one attains the fruit of stream-entry. If dharma cognition has not yet arisen or has already ceased, it is lost due to attaining the fruit. Dharma cognition appears in the present. Up to when one with occasional liberation changes faculties to become unshakable, if dharma cognition has not yet arisen or has already ceased, it is lost due to attaining the fruit and changing faculties. Dharma cognition appears in the present.
If one accomplishes future dharma cognition, does one also accomplish past and present [dharma cognition]?
Answer:

One may accomplish future dharma cognition but not past or present [dharma cognition], or past [dharma cognition] but not present, or present [dharma cognition] but not past, or past and present [dharma cognition].

One who has perfected future dharma cognition but neither past nor present dharma cognition is one who has obtained dharma cognition that has not yet ceased, or has ceased but is lost, and is not presently manifesting.
If one has obtained dharma cognition, it is clear that one has future [dharma cognition].
If it has not yet ceased, or has ceased but is lost, it is clear that one does not have past [dharma cognition].
If it is not presently manifesting, it is clear that one does not have present [dharma cognition].
At what time does one perfect future dharma cognition but not past or present dharma cognition?

In the path of seeing, one obtains the fruit of stream-entry, but has not yet arisen or caused the cessation of dharma cognition. The previously arisen and ceased [dharma cognition] is lost due to obtaining the fruit, and dharma cognition does not manifest in the present.

Up to the time when one liberated by wisdom changes faculties to become unshakable, one has not yet arisen or caused the cessation of dharma cognition. The previously arisen and ceased [dharma cognition] is lost due to obtaining the fruit and changing faculties, and dharma cognition does not manifest in the present.
And past but not present [dharma cognition] refers to one who has already arisen and ceased dharma cognition, but does not cause dharma cognition to manifest in the present.
If the Dharma cognition that has already arisen and ceased exists, then it is clear that there is a past.
If the Dharma cognition that has not yet arisen is present, then it is clear that there is no present.
If one possesses the past, one definitely possesses the future.
At what time does one possess the past and future Dharma cognition, but not the present?
Answer:
As previously explained, when one possesses the past and future Dharma cognition.
And when one possesses the present but not the past, it is when the Dharma cognition arises and is present, if it has not yet ceased, or even if it has ceased, one loses it.
When the Dharma cognition arises and is present, it is clear that there is a present.
If it has not yet ceased, or even if it has ceased, one loses it, then it is clear that there is no past.
If one possesses the present, one definitely possesses the future.
At what time does one possess the future and present Dharma cognition, but not the past?
Answer:
As previously explained, when one possesses the future and present Dharma cognition.
As for the past and present, if one has the knowledge of dharmas that arises and ceases without loss, and the knowledge of dharmas arises and is present.
If one has the knowledge of dharmas that arises and ceases without loss, it clarifies that there is the past.
The knowledge of dharmas that arises and is present clarifies that there is the present.
If one has the past and present, one definitely has the future.
At what time does one have the knowledge of dharmas of the three times?
Answer:
As explained above, at the time of having the knowledge of dharmas of the three times.
If one has the past and present knowledge of dharmas, does one also have the future?
Answer:
So it is.
If one has the present knowledge of dharmas, does one also have the past and future?
Answer:
One has the future, but one does not necessarily have the past. If it has ceased and not been lost, or if it has not yet ceased, or if it has ceased and been lost, then one does not have it.
At what time does one have the knowledge of dharmas of the three times?
Answer:
As explained earlier, when one attains the knowledge of dharmas of the three times,
if one attains past and future knowledge of dharmas, does one also attain the present [knowledge of dharmas]?
Answer:
If it is present, as explained earlier.
